diff_user.system:
You are an expert data engineer specializing in converting data to text. You will be given the current Python program with its scores and an inspiration program and your task will be to evolve the current Python program to improve the scores. It is a program that converts a list of triples into natural language text. The given triples will be associated with the topic: Airport. The program must implement a function called 'predict' that accepts a list of triples and generates a coherent, contextually relevant sentence that accurately represents the information contained in the triples. Ensure that the generated text is fluent, grammatically correct, and maintains the meaning of the original data. There can be multiple triples given that make up a complex sentence. Converting all those triples into one sentence will award greater score. There is also a dedicated score for sentence count called avg_sentences_length_score, where 1.0 is a perfect sentence count and 0.0 is the worst sentence count. An example of a complex sentence:
Triples:
(Antwerp | cityServed | Antwerp International Airport)
(Belgium | country | Antwerp)
(City of Brussels | capital | Belgium)
Example sentence:
"Antwerp International Airport serves the city of Antwerp which is in Belgium, where the capital is Brussels."

The 'predict' function returns that sentence as a string. Below is the list of all possible predicates that can be given as an input. With the given predicates and example triples implement the 'predict' function so it can process all the possible predicates:

Predicate: cityServed - Example triple: (Aarhus Airport | cityServed | "Aarhus, Denmark")
Predicate: elevationAboveTheSeaLevel - Example triple: (Aarhus Airport | elevationAboveTheSeaLevel | 25.0)
Predicate: location - Example triple: (Aarhus Airport | location | Tirstrup)
Predicate: operatingOrganisation - Example triple: (Aarhus Airport | operatingOrganisation | "Aarhus Lufthavn A/S")
Predicate: runwayLength - Example triple: (Aarhus Airport | runwayLength | 2776.0)

Predicate: country - Example triple: (Abilene, Texas | country | United States)
Predicate: isPartOf - Example triple: (Abilene, Texas | isPartOf | Jones County, Texas)
Predicate: 1stRunwayLengthFeet - Example triple: (Abilene Regional Airport | 1stRunwayLengthFeet | 3678)

# Current Program
```python
from dataclasses import dataclass

@dataclass
class Triple:
    subject: str
    predicate: str
    object: str

# EVOLVE-BLOCK-START

def predict(triples: list[Triple]) -> str:
    """
    Generates a sentence from a list of triples related to airports.
    """
    airport = None
    location_info = []
    runway_info = []
    other_info = []

    for triple in triples:
        subject = triple.subject
        predicate = triple.predicate
        object_val = triple.object

        if predicate == "cityServed":
            location_info.append(f"{subject} serves the city of {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "country":
            location_info.append(f"{subject} is located in {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "elevationAboveTheSeaLevel":
            location_info.append(f"{subject} has an elevation of {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "elevationAboveTheSeaLevelInFeet":
            location_info.append(f"{subject} has an elevation of {object_val} feet")
        elif predicate == "runwayLength":
            runway_info.append(f"{subject} has a runway length of {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "iataLocationIdentifier":
            location_info.append(f"{subject} has IATA code {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "location":
            location_info.append(f"{subject} is located in {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "operatingOrganisation":
            other_info.append(f"{subject} is operated by {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "hubAirport":
            other_info.append(f"{subject} is a hub for {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "headquarter":
            other_info.append(f"{subject} has headquarters in {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "nativeName":
            airport = object_val
        elif predicate == "runwayName":
            runway_info.append(f"{subject} has a runway named {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "runwaySurfaceType":
            runway_info.append(f"{subject} has a runway surface of {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "isPartOf":
            location_info.append(f"{subject} is part of {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "1stRunwayLengthFeet":
            runway_info.append(f"{subject} has a first runway length of {object_val} feet")
        elif predicate == "1stRunwaySurfaceType":
            runway_info.append(f"{subject} has a first runway surface of {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "3rdRunwayLengthFeet":
            runway_info.append(f"{subject} has a third runway length of {object_val} feet")
        elif predicate == "icaoLocationIdentifier":
            location_info.append(f"{subject} has ICAO code {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "locationIdentifier":
            location_info.append(f"{subject} has location identifier {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "elevationAboveTheSeaLevelInFeet":
            location_info.append(f"{subject} has an elevation of {object_val} feet")
        elif predicate == "leaderParty":
            other_info.append(f"{subject} is led by {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "capital":
            location_info.append(f"{subject}'s capital is {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "language":
            other_info.append(f"{subject} speaks {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "leader":
            other_info.append(f"{subject} is led by {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "owner":
            other_info.append(f"{subject} is owned by {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "1stRunwayLengthMetre":
            runway_info.append(f"{subject} has a first runway length of {object_val} metres")
        elif predicate == "4thRunwaySurfaceType":
            runway_info.append(f"{subject} has a fourth runway surface of {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "5thRunwayNumber":
            runway_info.append(f"{subject} has a fifth runway number {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "largestCity":
            location_info.append(f"{subject}'s largest city is {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "4thRunwayLengthFeet":
            runway_info.append(f"{subject} has a fourth runway length of {object_val} feet")
        elif predicate == "1stRunwayNumber":
            runway_info.append(f"{subject} has a first runway number {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "elevationAboveTheSeaLevelInMetres":
            location_info.append(f"{subject} has an elevation of {object_val} metres")
        elif predicate == "administrativeArrondissement":
            location_info.append(f"{subject} is in the {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "mayor":
            other_info.append(f"{subject}'s mayor is {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "2ndRunwaySurfaceType":
            runway_info.append(f"{subject} has a second runway surface of {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "3rdRunwaySurfaceType":
            runway_info.append(f"{subject} has a third runway surface of {object_val}")
        else:
            other_info.append(f"{subject} {predicate} {object_val}")

    parts = []
    if airport:
        parts.append(f"The airport known as {airport}")
    parts.extend(location_info)
    parts.extend(runway_info)
    parts.extend(other_info)

    if parts:
        sentence = ", ".join(parts) + "."
        sentence = sentence.replace(", .", ".")
        sentence = sentence.replace(" is located in ", " is in ") #Improve fluency
        sentence = sentence.replace(" has an elevation of ", " is at an elevation of ") #Improve fluency

    return sentence

# EVOLVE-BLOCK-END
```

### Inspiration 1 (Score: 0.3757)
```python
from dataclasses import dataclass

@dataclass
class Triple:
    subject: str
    predicate: str
    object: str

# EVOLVE-BLOCK-START

def predict(triples: list[Triple]) -> str:
    """
    Generates a sentence from a list of triples related to airports.
    """
    sentence = ""
    airport_name = None
    location_details = []
    runway_details = []
    other_details = []

    for triple in triples:
        subject = triple.subject
        predicate = triple.predicate
        object_val = triple.object

        if predicate == "cityServed":
            location_details.append(f"{subject} serves {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "country":
            location_details.append(f"{subject} is in {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "elevationAboveTheSeaLevel":
            location_details.append(f"{subject} is {object_val} meters above sea level")
        elif predicate == "elevationAboveTheSeaLevelInFeet":
            location_details.append(f"{subject} is {object_val} feet above sea level")
        elif predicate == "runwayLength":
            runway_details.append(f"The runway length of {subject} is {object_val} meters")
        elif predicate == "iataLocationIdentifier":
            location_details.append(f"{subject} has IATA code {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "location":
            location_details.append(f"{subject} is located in {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "operatingOrganisation":
            other_details.append(f"{subject} is operated by {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "hubAirport":
            other_details.append(f"{subject} is a hub airport for {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "headquarter":
            other_details.append(f"{subject}'s headquarters is in {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "nativeName":
            airport_name = object_val
        elif predicate == "runwayName":
            runway_details.append(f"{subject} has a runway named {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "runwaySurfaceType":
            runway_details.append(f"The runway surface of {subject} is {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "isPartOf":
            location_details.append(f"{subject} is part of {object_val}")
        elif predicate == "1stRunwayLengthFeet":
            runway_details.append(f"The first runway of {subject} is {object_val} feet long")
        elif predicate == "1stRunwaySurfaceType":
            runway_details.append(f"The first runway of {subject} is made of {object_val}")
        else:
            other_details.append(f"{subject} {predicate} {object_val}")

    parts = []
    if airport_name:
        parts.append(airport_name)
    parts.extend(location_details)
    parts.extend(runway_details)
    parts.extend(other_details)

    if parts:
        sentence = ", ".join(parts) + "."

    return sentence

# EVOLVE-BLOCK-END
```
